title.subtext1: I am Hubert Siwczyński, I am
title.subtext2:
years old and IT has been my hobby ever since I can remember. 
On this site I would like to show you who I am, describe my projects and things I am interested in.

first.title: I love creating new things
first.text: Until now every single new project, which I created had something special. I always take care of the creativity and I make things I do eye-catching.

second.title: I try different thing and ways
second.text: In my life I want to develop many skills and follow different ways of dealing with problems. I am not only a wabsite creator but also I try to fill up my other IT hobbies like: creating games, desingning, artworking, music composing or video editing. I have always been up to bigger things

third.title: I am always myself
third.text: I am a quite calm person, who is interested in creative things as well as those, which can help me develop. I like to meet new, sensible friends. The thing you can say about me is that I am totally honest. There cannot be too stuffy and seriously around me, although I prefer more to listen then talk.

projects.big_title: In this section I want to show you my biggest projects, which were made for greater audience or have deaper meaning
projects.medium_title: Here you can find the projects, which are neither too small nor extra big
projects.small_title: Here are small things which I was using to test technologies or to learn language more

menu.title: Projects
menu.subtitle: There, I will list the projects, which I created or which I took part in

theSquirrelDragon.title: Codename: TheSquirreldragon
theSquirrelDragon.description: This project is made for people who want to find anybody having simmilar hobbies. Right now, I would not like to reveal too many details, though. In contrast to Blackrats, this idea can be developed in one person but I'd really not want to make it alone. These days this project is half-done and waits for a crew ready to help me.

blackrats_second.title: Blackrats - Second and third try
blackrats_second.description: To these versions of this project we have joined in 2 persons with my Russian friend Alex. Unfortunately, the world is a cruel and a big time difference is between us, which made it too difficult to cooperate on it. We both felt that there was no point in going on to continue. At this point, for the first time I experienced the NodeJS and I loved it. We got to same spot as in the first version, but this time, even after a long time I can find myself in the code I wrote and I would be able to continue it at any point.

wspoldzielnia.title: Współdzielnia
wspoldzielnia.technologies: HTML, CSS, JQuery, PHP, Symfony, Firebase
wspoldzielnia.description: During the first version of the Blackrats in 2017 this project started. Being under the contract I wrote together with my friend from high school a big project for the customer from Tarnów Podgórny. I wrote the page (then I did not know that the Symfony was not a good framework for online shops. After some adventures I considered this project to be not worth my time and I resigned - I decided to better prepare myself for the upcoming Matura exam.

Blackrats_first.title: Blackrats - First version
Blackrats_first.technologies: HTML, CSS, JQuery, PHP, Symfony, SQL
Blackrats_first.description: The very first version of the Blackrats project started in 2016, which I developed alone.There was an idea to make something like Fiverr build to help beginners develop. The project scheme written using Symfony has a functioning login and registration panels, as well as the personalize profile page. I gave up because the framework itself was a big one.

OS_Symulator.title: Operating System Simulator
OS_Symulator.description: This project was written in C++ to pass one of my studies subject: Operating Systems. It was supposed to simulate a real operating system. The project was written in 7 people and each of us had to prepare one of the control modules. I had to create the assembler's interpreter. There were also: CPU, Processes, Locks, Disk, Interface and RAM. In the project we are able to work on processes and programs, but the i-node system is not running properly, which has been the main cause of the team's disintegration. We unfortunatelly split up on a deadline

assembler.title: Assembler's Interpreter
assembler.description: This is a project made for an individual Operating Systems subject passing after tearing out my team on the first group attempt. I had to do a simple interface for the entire program to prove it all works. The project after passing it unfortunately got lost and I can't find its source code to show here.

game_2048.title: Gra 2048
game_2048.description: A game based on the popular 2048, made in React. It has the ability to customize the entire board as well as 2 predefined modes - one standard 4x4 and the other my own 5x4 with negative numbers

theImpossibleGame.title: Game "The Impossible Game"
theImpossibleGame.description: A computer game written in the SFML library for C++ is a real copy of the known flash game World's Hardest Game. It is worth mentioning that I had 3 days until deadline, where I started with having a zero concept about this library. The game works identically as in the above mentioned production, I did not notice any crucial errors in it. It has 3 levels, a system of checkpoints and coins to gain.

portfolioWiewiorka.title: Portfolio Wiewiorka
portfolioWiewiorka.description: This is the project you are there :). A special project made for getting a work on studies. To create it, I learned Angular and Typescript. I spent near 2 months to create it.

nextjsTemplates.title: Next.js templates
nextjsTemplates.description: As I was writing theSquirreldragon app, I came up with an idea to make a Next.js template, which one I would be able to use for many projects. The simple version has multiple language support, basic error handling module, and has a log module. It is intended to create static pages for customers. The advanced version has a MongoDB database support, a session, basic login&registration panel, and the ability to change users' profile. It is made to use for larger projects.

UDP_Python.title: UDP Transfer
UDP_Python.description: The project was made in 2 persons for passing the Network Technologies subject. The purpose was to establish UDP transmission between the client and the server (1 to 1) in Python. The application asks whether you want to be client or server. It then works as follows: The application prompts the customer to specify the operation to be performed and the numbers required to complete the operation. It then sends the data to the server in a connectionless manner. Server process the data and sends the result back to the client.

Hamownia_drogowa.title: Road dynamometer app
Hamownia_drogowa.description: The project of the dynamometer itself was created in 3 persons, while the desktop application in Python was created mainly by me. It allows the user to enter the appropriate parameters such as: vehicle mass, rim diameter, tyre profile and so on. Then, after reading the relevant data from the slotter sensor, it determines the RPM graph and the engine power. The application has a system which valiates the data and smooths the chart.

chat.title: PHP Chat
chat.description: A PHP chat with a userlist was one of the first projects I did. The user was able to give their nick and enter the chat. The other users who were logged in are able to see the new guest. Users were able to see new message and their windows were automatically scrollered down. In 2017 I uploaded this project on a free cba.pl server, which no longer exists and invited friends to it.

checkers.title: Checkers
checkers.description: Made in JavaScript checkers had the ability to capture pawns, move them and turn them into the queens. It is a project that I made after a chat, but I have never finished it. I placed info about them here just for the memories.

microscope.title: Microscope
microscope.description: That project begun when I noticed in some online store's slider the possibility to zoom-in pictures and I was interensted in how it works. In my version, however, we can determine the zoom scale.

menu.title: Skills
menu.subtitle: In this section I will describe briefly the programs I can use and the languages which I operate with

photoshop.title: Adobe Photoshop
photoshop.description: I have been interested in this program for a very long time (I used it for photo modifications, i.e. background cutting, etc.), although I started to deal with it and create some more interesting projects from January 2020, when I started to edit random photos of my family and friends. Currently I know how to do basic image processing, correct it and apply filters. In my opinion, I am still far from being a professional editor, because this program has many advanced features. I try to learn them gradually on new projects, where I always add something new. So far, all my modifications have surprised my friends and family.

illustrator.title: Adobe Illustrator
illustrator.description: This is, in my opinion, the best program I have used. How many squirrels I drew on my fingers cannot be counted. That's the only program that will never make me tired and which I can use non-stop. I can draw with and without outlines, with and without a gradient, and things as detailed as I have no memory on my computer. I can apply filters to pictures. I also try to use different paint brushes and also create my own. In the future I would like to animate my drawings in After Effects and create scenes. I also tested Inkscape. Certainly, this program is faster, but it has a less intuitive interface.

html.title: HTML 5
html.description: Just like the life is not complete without death and taxes, there is no single web developer without HTML knowledge. I have never used the HTML 4. I try to use not only divs, but also newer HTML 5 tags such as: article, section, main, header and so forth

css.title: CSS 3
css.description: Typically, I start creating a page by setting the display attribute to flex for each element on the page. I know flexbox, transition and gradients well. I can use the position attribute without major surprises. I would be able to deal with problems such as creating a triangle, speech bubble or diamond.

javascript.title: JavaScript
javascript.description: At the beginning, I totally resigned from pure JS and started using JQuery right away. However, looking at newer versions, I figured out that this library was redundant and started to learn pure JavaScript. Now I don't know what I am not able to do in it. It is a very complex language in which I value flexibility and low syntactic sensitivity, which gives me a sense of freedom when I write in it. I can work with asynchronous functions, arrays, classes and objects. I can run ivona with it, read files with File Reader, catch and react to errors with promises. I am up to date with the Ecma 2018 standard.

typescript.title: Typescript
typescript.description: It's a javascript with types. I like that secifying types allows you to get variable hints from IDE, which normally it cannot find out. It includes a hermetization to classes. I was convinced to use it, then I made a project using it and I got to like it.

php.title: PHP
php.description: It is a very interesting and complex server language, but the very fact that you have to change the language in which you previously thought made me switch to Node.js. I have plenty of memories with it, because it was the language which I started writing my first web apps with. Most of its frameworks like Laravel or Symfony are used for large and heavy projects.

cpp.title: C++
cpp.description: A language that I got to use from the very beginning and still will remain in my mind. I can operate both in it and in pure C. I know how to operate on pointers (asterisk and shared pointers), dynamic arrays, lambda expressions, threads, maps, stacks, lists and so on. I am familiar with objects and class properties. I hate giving types everywhere and I find it quite old and quite inflexible.

python.title: Python
python.description: This language is like Wordpress for a desktop developer. Everything is built-in, you can write programs in it both objectively and linearly. For many things that I would spend 2 hours on in C++, there it is enough to load the library and write 5 lines of code. The language is pleasant, but too simple in my opinion. I think, it is not great language to begin with... because it doesn't really teach a lot of things. Whenever I have a choice to choose a language during my studies, I always choose Python because it takes me 2 days to write a project which was 5 months supposed to last. So far I have dealt with libraries like Tkinter, Matplotlib, socket, and xml. I created a few console applications and one window application.

sql.title: SQL
sql.description: A database language, the purpose of which is to separate several dependencies into 300 tables, and then connect them by relations. I prefer to use json db languages though, because I have then everything written in one file. I can construct triggers, procedures, and read data in xml format. My first contact with it was while dealing with the PHP language. I've already worked with MySQL, SQL Server and PostgreSQL.

mongodb.title: MongoDB
mongodb.description: This language is the most enjoyable database language I have come across. It is not as difficult to secure as Firebase because it has the ability to specify its own server IP as protection against intruders, and getting the data is not a complicated thing either. It supports multiple platforms and has many plugins.

firebase.title: Firebase
firebase.description: A money-making machine written by Google. This snake tempts with many amenities, but inside it is designed so that in case of success you will not be able to leave it. It does not give any access to user data and the possibility of saving them elsewhere than in the authorization panel (because it is impossible to write rules for the database then). I used it once and it did not impress me especially that its main protection are the rules. It is perfect for real-time projects and those small, static applications, due to the plenty of add-ons it has.

nodejs.title: Node.js
nodejs.description: I switched to it from Apache when I thought it would be worth learning about technologies other than PHP. I like the idea of ​​writing in Javascript on the server side. I started writing everything in Express right away so I don't know much about pure Node.js. I can use many dependencies, export and import modules. I know the basic packages for building pages, such as multer or bcrypt.

react.title: React
react.description: I find this framework very nice and extremely flexible. You can do literally anything with it without using unnecessary jQuery libraries. I like the ability to import components and the fact that HTML render takes place in JavaScript, so JavaScript code can be joined directly into HTML. You can make the whole site either on classes or on functions with hooks - I prefer on classes. So far it's my favorite framework and anything won't beat it quickly.

angular.title: Angular
angular.description: My first contact with Angular is when making this portfolio. It's for people who like to break down the application structure into multiple files. It's not as flexible as React and requires writing all functions in components. So far I know the complete basics and I can only do business card pages with basic routing and multiple languages ​​using i18n. I learned it mostly from my Udemy course.

nextjs.title: Next.js
nextjs.description: I decided to write about it separately, because it is a brilliant addition that facilitates the configuration of the website. It helps to configure the webpack for scss or babel add-ons (just import the appropriate package in the configuration file), and adds automatic routing, so you just need to place a JavaScript file in the directory to make the page accessible from the browser level. Another good thing is the _app.js configuration file, which runs when you enter any page, and _document.js, which allows you to create your own project scheme page.

jquery.title: JQuery
jquery.description: The library I spent many years with and I know it inside out. It saved web developers for many years, when pure JavaScript was still lame. It systematizes the download of elements from the DOM, has easy-to-use functions that are compatible with older browsers. When developing a website with Apache and PHP, it is rather difficult to imagine a life without it. React replaces it in 100%, it gives more interesting results and reduces the amount of written code, so if possible I prefer to follow its ways. JQuery becomes less and less useful, but I have a lot of respect for it.

pug.title: Pug
pug.description: I had little to do with the pug, but I did. I used it before React. It's good for simple pages. It has the ability to split the page into blocks and the ability to import, and arrange these blocks in various ways. It allows to write tags… without tags. The code becomes so much cleaner.

less.title: LESS
less.description: I use LESS when I use Apache because it can be easily added to application. I don't often use mixins but I know what they are for. I like CSS structuring and the ability to use variables and import them.

sass.title: SASS
sass.description: I use it in larger projects, but use it for the same purposes as LESSa. I don't see any major differences except the technology they are written on.

symfony.title: Symfony
symfony.description: It was the first framework I made my projects on. It was then in third version. I learned to use it in the MVC model. Unfortunately I did not use DRY too much then and copied the code all around. This framework was very large and fully synchronous. Ever since I remember it was very unintuitive and difficult, but after switching to Node.js nothing surprised me anymore.

sfml.title: SFML
sfml.description: Perfect library to start learning game development. I started from there and it was fun to work with. Sometimes it was so unintuitive that it took me 5 hours to try to use the pointer to download images from disk. Unfortunately, there is not enough information on the internet about the bugs that can occur in it. I made one game with 3 levels so far. I think I try to move to Uniity in the future.

flstudio.title: FL Studio
flstudio.description: I can create basic beats and use the built-in VST instruments and tools. I'm still learning everything, but my work is very satisfying so far. Recently I decided to use external instruments and also record vocals.

audacity.title: Audacity
audacity.description: I used this program for my first vocal remixes and edits. I did some remixes with Alvin and the Chipmunks that I later published. I like to record audio with it because it's much easier and more intuitive than FL Studio's recorder.

sonyvegas.title: Sony Vegas
sonyvegas.description: I started editing videos from this program. I know the basics like cuts, transitions, entrances, subtitles. I edited videos that are often needed for school. I don't have an amazing processor to render bigger things, but I managed to make my videos of trips to Iceland.

hitfilm.title: Hitfilm
hitfilm.description: I have edited films in it not many times and I don't know what experience with it. I think Sony Vegas is a more interesting program, but Hitfilm is a completely free and I always recommend it to people who do not have much experience in editing .

word.title: Word
word.description: I've been using this program for as long as I can remember. I know a lot about it (I'm not one of those people who use enter to get to the bottom of the page). I can create documents in a formal and informal styles, and those that are to be typically aesthetic appearance.

excel.title: Excel
excel.description: I used the spreadsheet in high school and college. I can create graphs, use various functions to operate on data, conditional and logical ones. Most tasks do not scare me, but I know people who can find a way out of more complex problems with I can't figure out. For sure I can handle the basic and more advanced calculations.

powerpoint.title: Powerpoint
powerpoint.description: Most of my presentations I created were the Powerpoint ones. I even made a game for school in it once. I don't have to write too much about it - I know most of the possibilities of this program.

access.title: Access
access.description: I learned to operate this database when I graduated from high school. From what I remember, these tasks were the least difficult for me always. I know everything I could do in SQL.

outlook.title: Outlook
outlook.description: I used this mail manager in Iceland. I picked up my mail and marked tasks on my calendar practically every day.

polish.title: Polish language
polish.description: I don't have to write much about it - my mother language, I have spoken in it since I can remember.

english.title: English
english.description: I operate well both in speech and writing - certainly enough that I found a job as a receptionist in Iceland. I passed the ACERT-B2 certificate in college, but so far I have not received it. However, I'm somewhere around C1 - I understand what they say in YouTube videos without subtitles. With full-length films it is only a bit worse (I only read subtitles when I want to understand the 100% of content, not like 80). I have no problems with talking about it, I try to speak fluently and vividly, sometimes I forget words. In the speech exam, I had 18 out of 20 points for the certificate.

german.title: German
german.description: There I only know the basics. When talking to Germans I use basic words, but I try to do it correctly. So far I have never had problems with a simple conversation, when interlocutors tried to speak slowly and repeat what they said. I know the things  what I have learned in elementary, middle and high school.

russian.title: Russian language
russian.description: I learn this language for fun. It is so similar to Polish and words easily get into your head. I think I know the language the same level as I know German. I have friends from Russia, but we usually speak English. I'm able to slowly read the Cyrillic alphabet.

menu.title: Experience
menu.subtitle: Here are listed the schools which I attended and all my previous internships

schools.main_title: Schools I attend or graduate from

lo3.title: III High School in Poznań with a mathematical, physical and IT profile
lo3.text: I attended this school for 3 years from 2015 to 2018. After all, I liked the basics of entrepreneurship, geography and biology the most. There was a lot of emphasis on mathematics and computer science, which I passed as an extended school exams. There I met very intelligent people.

pp.title: Poznań University of Technology faculty of Information Technology and Telecommunications
pp.text: I am almost in the third year of engineering studies. I attend these studies to enlarge my IT knowledge and for now I treat them as a curiosity. I learn all the most necessary things myself. There I learned how to work with assembler, linux, microprocessors, etc.

geotech.title: Geo-Tech Front page (in progress)
geotech.text: In order to pass student internships I created front page in Wordpress for a geological company.

fourthFloor.title: Receptionist 4th Floor Hotel in Reikjawik
fourthFloor.text: A crazy trip to Iceland in the summer of 2019, which I will remember for years. I worked for 2 months as a receptionist in a small hotel in Reykjavik. During the breaks between serving clients in English and fighting their PMS, I wrote them scripts in Javascript to make their lives easier. I also visited Reikjawik and I took plenty of Icelandic tours.
